full_summary:
### ** Tender Notice for Empty Containment Cell at Lamèque Harbour, New Brunswick**

#### **Tender Reference Information**

| Field Name (English) | Value |
| -------------------- | --- |
| **Title**            | Empty Containment Cell at Lamèque Harbour, N.B.                 |
| **Reference Number** | cb-460-84409139                                           |
| **Solicitation Number| 30005019                                                     |
| **Publication Date** | 2023-11-02                                                   |
| **Tender Closing Date| 2023-11-17T13:00:00                                          |
| **Expected Contract Start Date**  | None |
| **Expected Contract End Date**    | None |

#### **Procurement Information**

| Field Name (English) | Value |
| -------------------- | --- |
| **Procurement Category** | CNST   |
| **Procurement Method**   | Competitive - Open bidding                            |
| **Trade Agreements**     | Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)                |
| **Regions of Opportunity**| Canada                                              |
| **Regions of Delivery**   | New Brunswick                                        |

#### **Contracting Entity**

| Field Name (English)  | Value                     |
| -------------------- | ------------------------- |
| **Contracting Entity Name**| Fisheries and Oceans Canada   |
| **Contracting Entity Address** | 301 Bishop Drive, Fredericton, New Brunswick, E3C 2M6 |
| **Contact Information** | Karen Dolan, DFO.tenders-soumissions.MPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca, (782) 377-7245 |

#### **Tender Description and Requirements**

The Fisheries and Oceans Canada is soliciting proposals for the empty containment cell work at Lamèque Harbour, New Brunswick, under the procurement strategy for Indigenous businesses. This is an open tender, conditionally set-aside under the Government of Canada's Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business (PSIB) if two or more bids have been received by Indigenous businesses.

The work includes labour, products, construction materials, and services necessary to prepare a truck loading pad, excavate dredging material, haul and dispose of the material, restore the site, and clean the site access path and roads. The contract will include mobilization and demobilization of all equipment necessary to make progress and work in strict accordance with specifications and accompanying drawings, subject to all terms and conditions of the contract.

Note: Field Namenib is dropped and only values in English are included
